revised_title: The Role of Medulla Oblongata and Sympathetic Nervous System in Diabetes
tldr: The author's experiments on animals, particularly dogs and rabbits, showed that damage to the medulla oblongata or the sympathetic nervous system can lead to diabetes. By dividing specific parts of the sympathetic nervous system, the author discovered that the superior cervical ganglion causes the most rapid and strong diabetic effect. This research provides insights into the complex relationship between the nervous system and diabetes.
